00025 #ifndef _PHYSICS_COLLISIONRESPONSEHANDLER_
00026 #define _PHYSICS_COLLISIONRESPONSEHANDLER_
00027 
00028 #include <physics/physics>
00029 
00030 #include <physics/Collider>
00031 #include <physics/CollidableBody>
00032 #include <physics/CollisionDetector>
00033 
00034 
00035 namespace physics {
00036 
00037 class CollisionState;
00038 
00039 
00040 class CollisionResponseHandler : public Collider
00041 {
00042 public:
00043   CollisionResponseHandler(ref<CollisionDetector> collisionDetector) : collisionDetector(collisionDetector) {}
00044   virtual ~CollisionResponseHandler() {}
00045 
00046   virtual void handleCollision(ref<CollisionState> collisionState) = 0;
00047   
00048   virtual void collide(ref<const Collidable> collidable1, ref<const Collidable> collidable2) 
00049     { 
00050       Assert( instanceof(*collidable1, const CollidableBody) );
00051       Assert( instanceof(*collidable2, const CollidableBody) );
00052       ref<const CollidableBody> body1( narrow_ref<const CollidableBody>(collidable1) );
00053       ref<const CollidableBody> body2( narrow_ref<const CollidableBody>(collidable2) );
00054       handleCollision(collisionDetector->getCollisionState(body1, body2)); 
00055     }
00056   virtual void collide(ref<const CollidableGroup> group) { Collider::collide(group); }
00057 
00058 protected:
00059   CollisionResponseHandler() {}
00060   CollisionResponseHandler(const CollisionResponseHandler& h) : Collider(h) {}
00061   
00062   ref<CollisionDetector> collisionDetector; //!!! should be a weak pointer (as typically the detector has us as a listener - cyclic)
00063 };
00064 
00065 
00066 } // physics
00067 
00068 #endif
